name: Research and Records
section_name: Learn about Newfoundland research and records

choices.name: Get started with research for your Newfoundland ancestors.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for research resources. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about finding your ancestors in Newfoundland.

    ☆ FS Wiki:—Newfoundland—Finding Your Ancestors

  2. Explore resources for Newfoundland research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Newfoundland Resources

  3. Learn about records for Newfoundland.

    ☆ AA—Newfoundland Guide

  4. Learn about resources for finding ancestors in Newfoundland.

    ☆ Finding Your Ancestors in Newfoundland and Labrador
    ☆ AA—Newfoundland Genealogy

  5. Use the Newfoundland Record Selection Table to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Newfoundland Record Selection Table

  6. Explore a variety of records on the FreeCanadianAncestry site.
  7. Find county resources for Newfoundland and Labrador research.

  8. Learn about Newfoundland and Labrador military history on the NL GenWeb site.

name: Archives and Libraries
section_name: Learn about Newfoundland archives and libraries.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Newfoundland Archives and Libraries

  2. Learn about Newfoundland provincial archives in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Newfoundland Provincial Archives

  3. Learn about Newfoundland museums, libraries, and archives in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Newfoundland Provincial Archives

1. Learn about Newfoundland city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Newfoundland Directories

  2. Explore city directories in Newfoundland and Labrador on the CanGenealogy site.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for vital and birth records. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Newfoundland vital records in this article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Newfoundland Vital Records

  2. Learn about and search Newfoundland vital records.

    ☆ FS: Newfoundland Vital Records

  3. Learn about and search Newfoundland vital statistics.

    ☆ FS: Newfoundland Vital Statistics

  4. Explore links for birth records on the Newfoundland Family Histories.
  5. Get help with adoption topics on the Newfoundland Adoption Facebook page.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for census records. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Get an overview of Newfoundland censuses in this article.

    ☆ FS—Newfoundland Census

  2. Learn about and search the Newfoundland 1945 census.

    ☆ FS: Newfoundland 1945 Census

  3. Learn about and search the Newfoundland 1935 census.

    ☆ FS: Newfoundland 1935 Census

  4. Learn about and search the Newfoundland 1921 census.

    ☆ FS: Newfoundland 1921 Census

  5. Explore the MyFreeCensus site for Newfoundland state and county census records.
  6. Explore Newfoundland census records on the Automated Genealogy site.
  7. Explore Newfoundland census records on the CensusFinder site.

QUIKLinks

name: Church and Cemetery Records
section_name: Learn about Newfoundland church and cemetery records.

content.text:
1. Get an overview of Newfoundland church records in this article.

    ☆ FS—Newfoundland Church Records

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for church and cemetery records. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Explore Newfoundland cemetery records in this article.

    ☆ FS—Newfoundland Cemetery Records

  2. Browse the Interment.net site for Newfoundland cemetery records.
  3. Browse the I Dream of Genealogy site for Newfoundland cemetery records.
  4. Search the Find A Grave site for cemetery records.
  5. Search the BillionGraves site for cemetery records.

  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Newfoundland probate records in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Newfoundland Probate Records

  2. Learn about Newfoundland land and property records.

    ☆ FS—Newfoundland Land and property Records

  3. Explore Newfoundland and Labrador will transcriptions on the NL GenWeb site.

name: Maps and Gazetteers
section_name: Learn about Newfoundland maps and gazetteers.

content.text:
1. Explore the David Rumsey collection of Newfoundland maps.
  2. Explore the Canadiana maps collection.
  3. Explore the Perry-Castaneda site for maps of Newfoundland (search for Newfoundland on the page).
  4. Explore historical Newfoundland maps on the Historic Map Works site. Select Canada and Newfoundland in the drop-down menus.
  5. Find Newfoundland towns and communities on the RoadsideThoughts site.
  6. Search for Newfoundland place names on the John Cardinal site.

1. Learn about Newfoundland newspapers in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Newfoundland Newspapers

1. Find links to Newfoundland newspapers on the Wikipedia site.
  2. Explore Newfoundland and Labrador newspaper resources on the CanGenealogy site.
  3. Explore transcriptions of 19th-century newspapers on the NL GenWeb site.
  4. Search Newfoundland newspapers in the onlinenewspapers.com site.
  5. Search Newfoundland newspapers in the world-newspapers.com site.
  6. Search Newfoundland newspapers in the ABYZ News Link site.

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for Newfoundland research.

content.text:
1. Explore links on the CanGenealogy site.
  2. Explore links on the NL GenWeb site.
  3. Explore links in Cyndi's List.
  4. Explore links in GenealogyLinks.net.

choices.name: Use QUICKLinks to quickly search record collections for Newfoundland.

content.text:
• QUIKLinks are indicated by lightning-bolt icons in the Goal header area and in the page.
  • QUIKLinks point to collections with 50,000 or more records.

1. Explore the FamilySearch page for online genealogy records.
  2. Explore additional record collections in Ancestry.
  3. Explore additional record collections in Findmypast.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Newfoundland research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the Newfoundland Genealogical Society page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Newfoundland Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Find additional Facebook pages for Newfoundland genealogy on the Genealogy on Facebook site.

choices.name: Join a mailing list or message board for Newfoundland research.

content.text:
1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Newfoundland research.
  2. Search the RootsWeb site for Newfoundland research mailing lists.
  3. Explore the Newfoundland research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.

1. Learn about genealogy societies in Newfoundland in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Newfoundland Societies"
  2. Learn about genealogy societies in Newfoundland in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Newfoundland Societies

  3. Explore Newfoundland genealogy society sites on Cyndi's list.
  4. Get help at a family history center in Newfoundland.
